Platform.Title: Escherichia coli O157:H7 EDL933 Spotted PCR Array
Platform.Manufacturer: Chris Minion Laboratory at Iowa State University
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: The Escherichia coli O157:H7 EDL933 microarray consists of PCR products (100-500 bp) spotted to Corning UltraGAPS™ substrates. Each probe was printed in duplicate, in non-adjacent spots to reduce non-uniform substrate errors in replicated probes. The array consisted of 48 subarrays, with a 15-column x 15-row configuration.

Column.Name: ID
Column.Description: unique open reading frame identifier

Column.Name: Lprimer
Column.Description: Forward or Left primer used in amplification of DNA for spotting

Column.Name: Rprimer
Column.Description: Reverse or Right primer used in amplification of DNA for spotting

Column.Name: Size
Column.Description: size of product from primers that was spotted on array

Column.Name: GENOME_ACC
Column.Description: Genbank or Refseq accession

Column.Name: SEQUENCE
Column.Description: sequence of PCR product spotted on array

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: locus tag
Column.Link-Suffix: [gene name] AND Escherichia coli O157:H7 EDL933[organism]

Sample.Title: Escherichia coli O157:H7 EDL933 Inside Acanthamoeba vs. Control Slide 1

Channel.Source: Escherichia coli O157:H7 EDL933 Inside Acanthamoeba
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was isolated from samples using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen). Prior to lysis all samples were incubated for 30 min on ice in RNA stop solution (0.1% SDS, 1% Acidic phenol, 19% ethanol, ice cold). The lysis and digestion protocol was followed with two 50 μl ddH20 elutions. Each sample was treated with 2 μl of DNase (Ambion, Austin, TX) at 37°C for 30 min. Samples were purified and concentrated using Microcon YM-30 columns (Millipore, Billerica, MA), and the quantity and purity were determined using an ND-1000 spectrophotometer (Nanodrop, Wilmington, DE). Samples were determined to be free of contaminating genomic DNA by absence of a band on a DNA electrophoresis gel after 30 rounds of PCR.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Targets were generated from 10 µg of DNase treated total RNA as follows. Ten µg of total RNA was combined with 1 μl of 10 µg/μl random hexamers (Integrated DNA Technologies) and ddH20 was added to bring the total reaction volume to 15.5 μl. Samples were incubated at 70°C for 10 min followed by 10 min incubation on ice. After incubation, 14.5 μl of a reaction mix (6 μl of 5x First Strand Buffer, 1.2 μl of 25x aa-dUTP/dNTP mix (Fermentas, Glen Burnie, MD), 3 μl 0.1M DTT, 2 μl Superscript III 200U/ μl (Invitrogen Corp., Carlsbad, CA), 2.4 μl RNase-free water) was added and reactions were incubated at 42°C for at least 2 hrs. After incubation, RNA was immediately hydrolyzed by incubation with 3 μl 0.1 M ETDA and 3.5 μl 0.1 M NaOH at 65°C for 10 min. The pH was neutralized with the addition of 36.5 μl of 500 mM HEPES (pH 7.0). Reactions were purified using the Mo Bio UltraClean PCR Clean-Up Kit (MO BIO Laboratories, Inc., Carlsbad, CA), quantified using the ND-1000 spectrophotometer, dried-down, and resuspended in 10 μl RNase-free water and 1.5 μl sodium bicarbonate (pH 8.7). After 10 min, 6 μl of Cy 3 (catalog number PA25001) or Cy 5 (catalog number PA23001) (GE Healthcare, Piscataway, NJ) were added according the microarray experimental design, and samples were incubated at room temperature for 3 h. Dyes were prepared by resuspending a single tube of dye in 72 μl of DMSO and storing in 6 μl aliquots at -70°C until use. Dye coupled reactions were purified in the same manner as cDNA synthesis reactions. Frequency of dye incorporation and yield was determined using the ND-1000 spectrophotometer.

Channel.Source: Escherichia coli O157:H7 EDL933 Outside Control
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was isolated from samples using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen). Prior to lysis all samples were incubated for 30 min on ice in RNA stop solution (0.1% SDS, 1% Acidic phenol, 19% ethanol, ice cold). The lysis and digestion protocol was followed with two 50 μl ddH20 elutions. Each sample was treated with 2 μl of DNase (Ambion, Austin, TX) at 37°C for 30 min. Samples were purified and concentrated using Microcon YM-30 columns (Millipore, Billerica, MA), and the quantity and purity were determined using an ND-1000 spectrophotometer (Nanodrop, Wilmington, DE). Samples were determined to be free of contaminating genomic DNA by absence of a band on a DNA electrophoresis gel after 30 rounds of PCR.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Targets were generated from 10 µg of DNase treated total RNA as follows. Ten µg of total RNA was combined with 1 μl of 10 µg/μl random hexamers (Integrated DNA Technologies) and ddH20 was added to bring the total reaction volume to 15.5 μl. After incubation, 14.5 μl of a reaction mix (6 μl of 5x First Strand Buffer, 1.2 μl of 25x aa-dUTP/dNTP mix (Fermentas, Glen Burnie, MD), 3 μl 0.1M DTT, 2 μl Superscript III 200U/ μl (Invitrogen Corp., Carlsbad, CA), 2.4 μl RNase-free water) was added and reactions were incubated at 42°C for at least 2 hrs. After incubation, RNA was immediately hydrolyzed by incubation with 3 μl 0.1 M ETDA and 3.5 μl 0.1 M NaOH at 65°C for 10 min. The pH was neutralized with the addition of 36.5 μl of 500 mM HEPES (pH 7.0). Reactions were purified using the Mo Bio UltraClean PCR Clean-Up Kit (MO BIO Laboratories, Inc., Carlsbad, CA), quantified using the ND-1000 spectrophotometer, dried-down, and resuspended in 10 μl RNase-free water and 1.5 μl sodium bicarbonate (pH 8.7). Dyes were prepared by resuspending a single tube of dye in 72 μl of DMSO and storing in 6 μl aliquots at -70°C until use. Dye coupled reactions were purified in the same manner as cDNA synthesis reactions. Frequency of dye incorporation and yield was determined using the ND-1000 spectrophotometer.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: From each paired sample, 1.5 μg of labeled cDNA was combined, dried-down, resuspended in 60 μl Pronto! cDNA/long oligonucleotide hybridization solution (Corning), incubated at 95°C for 5 min and centrifuged at 13,000 × g for 2 min at room temperature. This solution was then pipetted on a freshly pre-hybridized microarray slide, covered with a 22 x 60 mm HybriSlip (Grace Bio Labs, Bend, OR), placed in a Corning hybridization chamber, and incubated in a 42°C water bath for 12 to 16 h. Array pre-hybridization was conducted using sodium borohydride as previously described (Raghavachari, et al., 2003). Slides were washed according to Corning’s UltraGAPS protocol and dried by centrifugation.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanning, image segmentation, and normalization were conducted as previously described (Madsen, et al., 2006).
Sample.Description: To better understand the impact of intracellular carriage of E. coli O157:H7 within a ruminant protozoa, global transcript levels of strain EDL933 cells grown under within Acanthamoeba were compared to cells grown in ATCC PYG712 using microarrays.
Sample.Data-Processing: Mixed model analysis was conducted as previously described (Madsen, et al., 2006) excluding slide region and slide-by-region interaction effects. The value column was not used for analysis or in publication. The normalized values for duplicate spots were averaged within each array to produce one normalized measure of expression for each of the probe sequences and each of the RNA samples. [mean log transformed median centered lowess normalized signal intensity]

Column.Name: n
Column.Description: number of spots from which spot mean intenstiy was generated

Column.Name: X1
Column.Description: Slide 1, background subtracted log transformed median centered Lowess normalized signal intensity,inside acanthamoeba, Cy3

Column.Name: X2
Column.Description: Slide 1, background subtracted log transformed median centered Lowess normalized signal intensity,outside control, Cy5

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Gene expression Ratio log(Inside Acanthamoeba trt)-log(outside control)

After incubation, 14.5 μl of a reaction mix (6 μl of 5x First Strand Buffer, 1.2 μl of 25x aa-dUTP/dNTP mix (Fermentas, Glen Burnie, MD), 3 μl 0.1M DTT, 2 μl Superscript III 200U/ μl (Invitrogen Corp., Carlsbad, CA), 2.4 μl RNase-free water) was added and reactions were incubated at 42°C for at least 2 hrs. After incubation, RNA was immediately hydrolyzed by incubation with 3 μl 0.1 M ETDA and 3.5 μl 0.1 M NaOH at 65°C for 10 min. The pH was neutralized with the addition of 36.5 μl of 500 mM HEPES (pH 7.0). Reactions were purified using the Mo Bio UltraClean PCR Clean-Up Kit (MO BIO Laboratories, Inc., Carlsbad, CA), quantified using the ND-1000 spectrophotometer, dried-down, and resuspended in 10 μl RNase-free water and 1.5 μl sodium bicarbonate (pH 8.7). After 10 min, 6 μl of Cy 3 (catalog number PA25001) or Cy 5 (catalog number PA23001) (GE Healthcare, Piscataway, NJ) were added according the microarray experimental design, and samples were incubated at room temperature for 3 h. Dyes were prepared by resuspending a single tube of dye in 72 μl of DMSO and storing in 6 μl aliquots at -70°C until use. Dye coupled reactions were purified in the same manner as cDNA synthesis reactions. Frequency of dye incorporation and yield was determined using the ND-1000 spectrophotometer.

Channel.Source: Escherichia coli O157:H7 EDL933 Outside Control
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was isolated from samples using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen). Prior to lysis all samples were incubated for 30 min on ice in RNA stop solution (0.1% SDS, 1% Acidic phenol, 19% ethanol, ice cold). The lysis and digestion protocol was followed with two 50 μl ddH20 elutions. Each sample was treated with 2 μl of DNase (Ambion, Austin, TX) at 37°C for 30 min. Samples were purified and concentrated using Microcon YM-30 columns (Millipore, Billerica, MA), and the quantity and purity were determined using an ND-1000 spectrophotometer (Nanodrop, Wilmington, DE). Samples were determined to be free of contaminating genomic DNA by absence of a band on a DNA electrophoresis gel after 30 rounds of PCR.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Targets were generated from 10 µg of DNase treated total RNA as follows. After incubation, RNA was immediately hydrolyzed by incubation with 3 μl 0.1 M ETDA and 3.5 μl 0.1 M NaOH at 65°C for 10 min. Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: From each paired sample, 1.5 μg of labeled cDNA was combined, dried-down, resuspended in 60 μl Pronto! cDNA/long oligonucleotide hybridization solution (Corning), incubated at 95°C for 5 min and centrifuged at 13,000 × g for 2 min at room temperature. This solution was then pipetted on a freshly pre-hybridized microarray slide, covered with a 22 x 60 mm HybriSlip (Grace Bio Labs, Bend, OR), placed in a Corning hybridization chamber, and incubated in a 42°C water bath for 12 to 16 h. Array pre-hybridization was conducted using sodium borohydride as previously described (Raghavachari, et al., 2003). Slides were washed according to Corning’s UltraGAPS protocol and dried by centrifugation.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanning, image segmentation, and normalization were conducted as previously described (Madsen, et al., 2006).
Sample.Description: To better understand the impact of intracellular carriage of E. coli O157:H7 within a ruminant protozoa, global transcript levels of strain EDL933 cells grown under within Acanthamoeba were compared to cells grown in ATCC PYG712 using microarrays.
Sample.Data-Processing: Mixed model analysis was conducted as previously described (Madsen, et al., 2006) excluding slide region and slide-by-region interaction effects. The value column was not used for analysis or in publication. The normalized values for duplicate spots were averaged within each array to produce one normalized measure of expression for each of the probe sequences and each of the RNA samples. Channel.Label-Protocol: Targets were generated from 10 µg of DNase treated total RNA as follows. Ten µg of total RNA was combined with 1 μl of 10 µg/μl random hexamers (Integrated DNA Technologies) and ddH20 was added to bring the total reaction volume to 15.5 μl. Samples were incubated at 70°C for 10 min followed by 10 min incubation on ice. After incubation, 14.5 μl of a reaction mix (6 μl of 5x First Strand Buffer, 1.2 μl of 25x aa-dUTP/dNTP mix (Fermentas, Glen Burnie, MD), 3 μl 0.1M DTT, 2 μl Superscript III 200U/ μl (Invitrogen Corp., Carlsbad, CA), 2.4 μl RNase-free water) was added and reactions were incubated at 42°C for at least 2 hrs. After incubation, RNA was immediately hydrolyzed by incubation with 3 μl 0.1 M ETDA and 3.5 μl 0.1 M NaOH at 65°C for 10 min. The pH was neutralized with the addition of 36.5 μl of 500 mM HEPES (pH 7.0). Reactions were purified using the Mo Bio UltraClean PCR Clean-Up Kit (MO BIO Laboratories, Inc., Carlsbad, CA), quantified using the ND-1000 spectrophotometer, dried-down, and resuspended in 10 μl RNase-free water and 1.5 μl sodium bicarbonate (pH 8.7). After 10 min, 6 μl of Cy 3 (catalog number PA25001) or Cy 5 (catalog number PA23001) (GE Healthcare, Piscataway, NJ) were added according the microarray experimental design, and samples were incubated at room temperature for 3 h. Dyes were prepared by resuspending a single tube of dye in 72 μl of DMSO and storing in 6 μl aliquots at -70°C until use. Dye coupled reactions were purified in the same manner as cDNA synthesis reactions. Frequency of dye incorporation and yield was determined using the ND-1000 spectrophotometer.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: From each paired sample, 1.5 μg of labeled cDNA was combined, dried-down, resuspended in 60 μl Pronto! cDNA/long oligonucleotide hybridization solution (Corning), incubated at 95°C for 5 min and centrifuged at 13,000 × g for 2 min at room temperature. This solution was then pipetted on a freshly pre-hybridized microarray slide, covered with a 22 x 60 mm HybriSlip (Grace Bio Labs, Bend, OR), placed in a Corning hybridization chamber, and incubated in a 42°C water bath for 12 to 16 h. Array pre-hybridization was conducted using sodium borohydride as previously described (Raghavachari, et al., 2003). Slides were washed according to Corning’s UltraGAPS protocol and dried by centrifugation.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanning, image segmentation, and normalization were conducted as previously described (Madsen, et al., 2006).
Sample.Description: To better understand the impact of intracellular carriage of E. coli O157:H7 within a ruminant protozoa, global transcript levels of strain EDL933 cells grown under within Acanthamoeba were compared to cells grown in ATCC PYG712 using microarrays.
Sample.Data-Processing: Mixed model analysis was conducted as previously described (Madsen, et al., 2006) excluding slide region and slide-by-region interaction effects. The value column was not used for analysis or in publication. The normalized values for duplicate spots were averaged within each array to produce one normalized measure of expression for each of the probe sequences and each of the RNA samples. [mean log transformed median centered lowess normalized signal intensity]

Column.Name: n
Column.Description: number of spots from which spot mean intenstiy was generated

Column.Name: X17
Column.Description: Slide 9, background subtracted log transformed median centered Lowess normalized signal intensity,inside acanthamoeba, Cy3

Column.Name: X18
Column.Description: Slide 9, background subtracted log transformed median centered Lowess normalized signal intensity,outside control, Cy5

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Gene expression Ratio log(Inside Acanthamoeba trt)-log(outside control)

Series.Title: Transcriptome analysis of Escherichia coli O157:H7 EDL933 inside Acanthamoeba using microarrays
Series.Summary: The transcriptome of Escherichia coli K-12 has been widely studied over a variety of conditions for the past decade while such studies involving E. coli O157:H7, its pathogenic cousin, are just now being conducted. To better understand the impact of intracellular life within a ruminant and environmental protozoan on E. coli O157:H7, global transcript levels of strain EDL933 cells inside Acanthamoeba were compared to cell grown in the protozoan media (ATCC PYG712) by microarray.
Series.Overall-Design: Nine independent RNA samples from cell from within Acanthamoeba were paired with seven independent RNA samples from control cultures for hybridization to nine two-color microarrays. For four arrays, the control RNA sample was labeled with Cy3 dye and the experimental RNA sample was labeled with Cy5 dye, the dyes were reversed for the other five arrays to overcome dye bias.
